properties.name: security.basic.enabled
properties.description: Enable basic authentication.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.filter-dispatcher-types
properties.description: Security filter chain dispatcher types.

properties.name: security.filter-order
properties.description: Security filter chain order.

properties.name: server.error.whitelabel.enabled
properties.description: Enable the default error page displayed in browsers in case of a server error.

properties.name: spring.aop.auto
properties.description: Add @EnableAspectJAutoProxy.

properties.name: spring.aop.proxy-target-class
properties.description: Whether subclass-based (CGLIB) proxies are to be created (true) as opposed to standard Java interface-based proxies (false).

properties.name: spring.application.admin.enabled
properties.description: Enable admin features for the application.

properties.name: spring.application.admin.jmx-name
properties.description: JMX name of the application admin MBean.

properties.name: spring.autoconfigure.exclude
properties.description: Auto-configuration classes to exclude.

properties.name: spring.batch.job.enabled
properties.description: Execute all Spring Batch jobs in the context on startup.

properties.name: spring.dao.exceptiontranslation.enabled
properties.description: Enable the PersistenceExceptionTranslationPostProcessor.

properties.name: spring.datasource.jmx-enabled
properties.description: Enable JMX support (if provided by the underlying pool).

properties.name: spring.data.cassandra.reactive-repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Cassandra reactive repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.cassandra.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Cassandra repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.couchbase.reactive-repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Couchbase reactive repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.couchbase.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Couchbase repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.elasticsearch.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Elasticsearch repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.jpa.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable JPA repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.ldap.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable LDAP repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.mongodb.reactive-repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Mongo reactive repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.mongodb.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Mongo repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.neo4j.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Neo4j repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.redis.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Redis repositories.

properties.name: spring.data.solr.repositories.enabled
properties.description: Enable Solr repositories.

properties.name: spring.http.encoding.enabled
properties.description: Enable http encoding support.

properties.name: spring.http.converters.preferred-json-mapper
properties.description: Preferred JSON mapper to use for HTTP message conversion, auto-detected according to the environment by default.

properties.name: spring.jmx.default-domain
properties.description: JMX domain name.

properties.name: spring.jmx.enabled
properties.description: Expose management beans to the JMX domain.

properties.name: spring.jmx.server
properties.description: MBeanServer bean name.

properties.name: spring.jta.enabled
properties.description: Enable JTA support.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.allow-multiple-lrc
properties.description: Allow multiple LRC resources to be enlisted into the same transaction.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.asynchronous2-pc
properties.description: Enable asynchronously execution of two phase commit.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.background-recovery-interval
properties.description: Interval in minutes at which to run the recovery process in the background.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.background-recovery-interval-seconds
properties.description: Interval in seconds at which to run the recovery process in the background.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.current-node-only-recovery
properties.description: Recover only the current node. Should be enabled if you run multiple instances of the transaction manager on the same JMS and JDBC resources.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.debug-zero-resource-transaction
properties.description: Log the creation and commit call stacks of transactions executed without a single enlisted resource.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.default-transaction-timeout
properties.description: Default transaction timeout in seconds.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.disable-jmx
properties.description: Enable JMX support.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.exception-analyzer
properties.description: Set the fully qualified name of the exception analyzer implementation to use.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.filter-log-status
properties.description: Enable filtering of logs so that only mandatory logs are written.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.force-batching-enabled
properties.description: Set if disk forces are batched.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.forced-write-enabled
properties.description: Set if logs are forced to disk.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.graceful-shutdown-interval
properties.description: Maximum amount of seconds the TM will wait for transactions to get done before aborting them at shutdown time.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.jndi-transaction-synchronization-registry-name
properties.description: JNDI name of the TransactionSynchronizationRegistry.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.jndi-user-transaction-name
properties.description: JNDI name of the UserTransaction.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.journal
properties.description: Name of the journal. Can be 'disk', 'null' or a class name.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.log-part1-filename
properties.description: Name of the first fragment of the journal.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.log-part2-filename
properties.description: Name of the second fragment of the journal.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.max-log-size-in-mb
properties.description: Maximum size in megabytes of the journal fragments.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.resource-configuration-filename
properties.description: ResourceLoader configuration file name.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.server-id
properties.description: ASCII ID that must uniquely identify this TM instance. Default to the machine's IP address.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.skip-corrupted-logs
properties.description: Skip corrupted transactions log entries. Use only at last resort when all you have to recover is a pair of corrupted files.

properties.name: spring.jta.bitronix.properties.warn-about-zero-resource-transaction
properties.description: Log a warning for transactions executed without a single enlisted resource.

properties.name: spring.mobile.devicedelegatingviewresolver.enabled
properties.description: Enable device view resolver.

properties.name: spring.mobile.sitepreference.enabled
properties.description: Enable SitePreferenceHandler.

properties.name: spring.mvc.favicon.enabled
properties.description: Enable resolution of favicon.ico.

properties.name: spring.mvc.formcontent.putfilter.enabled
properties.description: Enable Spring's HttpPutFormContentFilter.

properties.name: spring.rabbitmq.dynamic
properties.description: Create an AmqpAdmin bean.

properties.name: spring.social.auto-connection-views
properties.description: Enable the connection status view for supported providers.

properties.name: flyway.check-location
properties.description: Check that migration scripts location exists.

properties.name: flyway.enabled
properties.description: Enable flyway.

properties.name: flyway.init-sqls
properties.description:
SQL statements to execute to initialize a connection immediately after obtaining
 it.

properties.name: flyway.locations
properties.description:
Locations of migrations scripts. Can contain the special "{vendor}" placeholder to
 use vendor-specific locations.

properties.name: flyway.password
properties.description: Login password of the database to migrate.

properties.name: flyway.url
properties.description:
JDBC url of the database to migrate. If not set, the primary configured data source
 is used.

properties.name: flyway.user
properties.description: Login user of the database to migrate.

properties.name: liquibase.change-log
properties.description: Change log configuration path.

properties.name: liquibase.check-change-log-location
properties.description: Check the change log location exists.

properties.name: liquibase.contexts
properties.description: Comma-separated list of runtime contexts to use.

properties.name: liquibase.default-schema
properties.description: Default database schema.

properties.name: liquibase.drop-first
properties.description: Drop the database schema first.

properties.name: liquibase.enabled
properties.description: Enable liquibase support.

properties.name: liquibase.labels
properties.description: Comma-separated list of runtime labels to use.

properties.name: liquibase.parameters
properties.description: Change log parameters.

properties.name: liquibase.password
properties.description: Login password of the database to migrate.

properties.name: liquibase.rollback-file
properties.description: File to which rollback SQL will be written when an update is performed.

properties.name: liquibase.url
properties.description:
JDBC url of the database to migrate. If not set, the primary configured data source
 is used.

properties.name: liquibase.user
properties.description: Login user of the database to migrate.

properties.name: security.basic.authorize-mode
properties.description: Security authorize mode to apply.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.basic.path
properties.description: Comma-separated list of paths to secure.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.basic.realm
properties.description: HTTP basic realm name.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.enable-csrf
properties.description: Enable Cross Site Request Forgery support.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.headers.cache
properties.description: Enable cache control HTTP headers.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.headers.content-security-policy
properties.description: Value for content security policy header.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.headers.content-security-policy-mode
properties.description: Content security policy mode.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.headers.content-type
properties.description: Enable "X-Content-Type-Options" header.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.headers.frame
properties.description: Enable "X-Frame-Options" header.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.headers.hsts
properties.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) mode (none, domain, all).

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.headers.xss
properties.description: Enable cross site scripting (XSS) protection.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.ignored
properties.description: Comma-separated list of paths to exclude from the default secured paths.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.require-ssl
properties.description: Enable secure channel for all requests.

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.sessions
properties.description: Session creation policy (always, never, if_required, stateless).

deprecation.reason: The security auto-configuration is no longer customizable. Provide your own WebSecurityConfigurer bean instead.

properties.name: security.user.name
properties.description: Default user name.

deprecation.reason: The default user is no longer customizable. You can, for instance, define a bean of type UserDetailsService.

properties.name: security.user.password
properties.description: Password for the default user name.

deprecation.reason: The default user is no longer customizable. You can, for instance, define a bean of type UserDetailsService.

properties.name: security.user.role
properties.description: Granted roles for the default user name.

deprecation.reason: The default user is no longer customizable. You can, for instance, define a bean of type UserDetailsService.

properties.name: server.context-parameters
properties.description: ServletContext parameters.

properties.name: server.context-path
properties.description: Context path of the application.

properties.name: server.max-http-post-size
properties.description: Maximum size in bytes of the HTTP post content.

deprecation.reason: Use dedicated property for each container.

properties.name: server.servlet-path
properties.description: Path of the main dispatcher servlet.

properties.name: server.undertow.buffers-per-region
properties.description: Number of buffer per region.

properties.name: spring.batch.initializer.enabled
properties.description:
Create the required batch tables on startup if necessary. Enabled automatically
 if no custom table prefix is set or if a custom schema is configured.

properties.name: spring.data.neo4j.compiler
properties.description: Compiler to use.

deprecation.reason: Not supported anymore as of Neo4j 3.

properties.name: spring.git.properties
properties.description: Resource reference to a generated git info properties file.

properties.name: spring.http.multipart.enabled
properties.description: Enable support of multipart uploads.

properties.name: spring.http.multipart.file-size-threshold
properties.description:
Threshold after which files will be written to disk. Values can use the suffixes
 "MB" or "KB" to indicate megabytes or kilobytes respectively.

properties.name: spring.http.multipart.location
properties.description: Intermediate location of uploaded files.

properties.name: spring.http.multipart.max-file-size
properties.description:
Max file size. Values can use the suffixes "MB" or "KB" to indicate megabytes or
 kilobytes respectively.

properties.name: spring.http.multipart.max-request-size
properties.description:
Max request size. Values can use the suffixes "MB" or "KB" to indicate megabytes or
 kilobytes respectively.

properties.name: spring.http.multipart.resolve-lazily
properties.description:
Whether to resolve the multipart request lazily at the time of file or parameter
 access.

properties.name: spring.jpa.hibernate.naming.strategy
properties.description:
Hibernate 4 naming strategy fully qualified name. Not supported with Hibernate
 5.

deprecation.reason: Auto-configuration for Hibernate 4 is no longer provided.

properties.name: spring.redis.pool.max-active
properties.description:
Max number of connections that can be allocated by the pool at a given time.
 Use a negative value for no limit.

properties.name: spring.redis.pool.max-idle
properties.description:
Max number of "idle" connections in the pool. Use a negative value to indicate
 an unlimited number of idle connections.

properties.name: spring.redis.pool.max-wait
properties.description:
Maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) a connection allocation should block
 before throwing an exception when the pool is exhausted. Use a negative value
 to block indefinitely.

properties.name: spring.redis.pool.min-idle
properties.description:
Target for the minimum number of idle connections to maintain in the pool. This
 setting only has an effect if it is positive.

properties.name: spring.sendgrid.password
properties.description: SendGrid password.

deprecation.reason: The use of a username and password is no longer supported (Use spring.sendgrid.api-key instead).

properties.name: spring.sendgrid.username
properties.description: SendGrid username. Alternative to api key.

deprecation.reason: The use of a username and password is no longer supported (Use spring.sendgrid.api-key instead).

properties.name: spring.session.jdbc.initializer.enabled
properties.description:
Create the required session tables on startup if necessary. Enabled
 automatically if the default table name is set or a custom schema is
 configured.

properties.name: spring.thymeleaf.content-type
properties.description: Content-Type value.

properties.name: spring.webservices.wsdl-locations
properties.description: Comma-separated list of locations of WSDLs and accompanying XSDs to be exposed as beans.

values.description: Automatically reset the offset to the earliest offset.
Automatically reset the offset to the latest offset.
Throw exception to the consumer if no previous offset is found for the consumer's group.
Validate the schema, make no changes to the database.
Create the schema and destroy previous data.
Create and then destroy the schema at the end of the session.
